I 100% agree that Bitcoin Cash supporters shouldn't try to pretend Bitcoin isn't Bitcoin. BTC is Bitcoin. It has the most accumulated proof of work originating from the genesis block, and the highest market cap, both by wide margins. Thus it's Bitcoin.

SegWit2x was a proposal to upgrade Bitcoin itself with SegWit and then a 2MB block. It failed to achieve majority support for the second part of that, thus the second part was called off. It was not a plan to create a pointless minority fork.

Q to BIS Chief (paraphrase): "Shouldn't there be urgency to regulate crypto?" A: "Always attempts to make money out of nothing ... what's not controlled here is the supply. Laissez fair experiments have historically proven to be the wrong approach" https:// youtu.be/Uyt0-QXLXtA?t= 1h16m9s …

BIS Chief Q: "What regulatory actions do you recommend for cryptocurrencies?" A (paraphrase): "BTC exchanges interact with financial system, that is where we can act and regulate them, just like we do with traditional financial intermediaries." https:// youtu.be/Uyt0-QXLXtA?t= 1h8m17s …

Q to BIS Chief: "Are current levels of activity in cryptocurrency markets already a threat to financial stability?" A: "Not yet a systemic risk. But social concern ... millions at risk of losing their money ... can weaken trust in financial system" https:// youtu.be/Uyt0-QXLXtA?t= 1h4m51s …

"CBs and fin. authorities should pay special attention to ... the ties linking cryptocurrencies to real currencies, to ensure that the relationship is not parasitic. And ... to the level playing field principle. This means “same risk, same regulation”. No exceptions allowed."

BIS Chief Carstens: "if authorities do not act pre-emptively, cryptocurrencies could become more interconnected with the main financial system and become a threat to financial stability" Full speech: https://www. bis.org/speeches/sp180 206.pdf …
